question.questionA: Buds with one outer scale; bracts of catkins entire.
question.questionB: Buds with several outer scales; bracts of catkins dentate or fringed.

question.questionA: Leaves on main tree (i.e. not suckers) glabrous; catkin scales divided to more  than halfway; stigmas purple; petiole strongly compressed laterally.
question.questionB: At least leaves at the ends of the main shoots persistently tomentose beneath; catkin scales not divided to halfway; stigmas green; petiole scarcely compressed laterally.

question.questionA: Leaves of sucker-shoots and ends of long  shoots  deeply  palmately  five-lobed,  leaves of short shoots persistently tomentose; catkin scales dentate.
question.questionB: Leaves of  sucker-shoots not deeply  lobed,  leaves of  short shoots becoming more or less glabrous; catkin scales laciniate.
